result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Fredrickson.   This case was dismissed but read in for sentencing purposes in 15CF166 and 16CF45.
Restitution Worksheet.  Electronically sent to Judge Becker.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on April 15, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Fredrickson.  No agreement yet.  Set 16CF45 for 1 hour preliminary hearing.  Track all others with STC same date and time.

Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Information filed with the Court.  Reading of the information waived.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by the court. PTC set for 3/30 and STC set for 4/4/16 at 3 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Attorney Fredrickson requested sequestration of the witnesses.  State called Det. M.K.  sworn.  Employment and training described by the witness.  9/20/15.  On duty.  Witness described the call and investigation.  Witness identified the defendant.  Record reflected the identification.  Attorney Fredrickson cross examined the witness.  State redirect.  State called Capt. K.B.  sworn.  Employed w/JASO approx. 10 years.  Witness described the search of the defendant's residence and her investigation.  Attorney Fredrickson cross examined the witness.  No further questions.  State called Deputy D.S., sworn.  Employed w/JASO for approx. 4 years.  Training described.  On duty 9/2/15.  Witness described the call and investigation.  Attorney Fredrickson cross examined the witness.  No redirect by State.  No other witnesses.  State moved for bind over.  Court found probable cause.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Deputy D.S. to appear at 3/11 preliminary hearing.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Captain Kelly Bakken to appear at the preliminary hearing on 3-11-16 at 10:15
Preliminary hearing at 03-11-2016 10:15 am

(This is what was on the bond as conditions) 

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Defendant failed to appear at preliminary hearing.  3 officers were subpoenaed, and present.  Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 3/4/16 at 10:30 am.  Bond increased to $1500.00 total.  Defendant must post $500.00 more.  Same conditions as previously ordered.

DEFENDANT MUST POST AN ADDITIONAL $500.00.  Covers Case No. 15CF80, 15CF181, 15CF166, 15CM88, 15CT24.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:   co- defendant:  A.G.,  Arrowhead Lodge, its property or employees, Sunrise Security Storage, or D.B, the victim in 15CF166, or G.K., the victim in 15CF181.
Defendant taken into custody, pending posting of additional bond.
